perturbation.original_text: THIS SECOND AMENDMENT TO CO-BRANDING AGREEMENT (this "Amendment") is made and entered into, effective for all purposes and in all respects as of the 23rd day of February, 1998, by and between PC QUOTE, INC., with its principal place of business at 300 South Wacker Drive, Chicago, Illinois 60605 ("PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc., with its principal place of business at 33 West 17th Street, New York, New York 10011 ("ABW").
perturbation.changed_text: THIS SECOND AMENDMENT TO CO-BRANDING AGREEMENT (this "Suggestion") is made and entered into, effective for all purposes and in all respects as of the 23rd day of February, 1998, by and between PC QUOTE, INC., with its principal place of business at 300 South Wacker Drive, Chicago, Illinois 60605 ("PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc., with its principal place of business at 33 West 17th Street, New York, New York 10011 ("ABW").
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Amendment' to 'Suggestion' creates a contradiction. An 'Amendment' legally binds parties to modified terms. 'Suggestion' implies non-binding advice, undermining the contract's enforceability. This creates ambiguity about whether the changes are legally required.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - principles requiring clear intent to be bound

perturbation.original_text: To the extent, if any, that provision of this Agreement conflicts with or differs from any provision of the Agreement, such provision of this Second Amendment shall prevail and govern for all purposes and in all respects.
perturbation.changed_text: To the extent, if any, that provision of this Agreement conflicts with or differs from any provision of the Agreement, such provision of this Second Suggestion shall be advisory and non-binding.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'Amendment' to 'Suggestion,' the clause that dictates the precedence of the amendment's terms is rendered advisory and non-binding. This fundamentally undermines the purpose of the amendment to alter the original agreement, and creates a clear contradiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Principles of precedence and contract modification
